org.mozilla.gecko

Class GeckoNetworkManager

  • Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • org.mozilla.gecko.GeckoNetworkManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BundleEventListener

    public class GeckoNetworkManager
extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver
implements BundleEventListener
    Provides connection type, subtype and general network status (up/down). According to spec of Network Information API version 3, connection types include: bluetooth, cellular, ethernet, none, wifi and other. The objective of providing such general connection is due to some security concerns. In short, we don't want to expose exact network type, especially the cellular network type. Specific mobile subtypes are mapped to general 2G, 3G and 4G buckets. Logic is implemented as a state machine, so see the transition matrix to figure out what happens when. This class depends on access to the context, so only use after GeckoAppShell has been initialized.

      • getNextState

        @Nullable
public static GeckoNetworkManager.ManagerState getNextState(@NonNull
                                                                      GeckoNetworkManager.ManagerState currentState,
                                                                      @NonNull
                                                                      GeckoNetworkManager.ManagerEvent event)
        Defines a transition matrix for our state machine. For a given state/event pair, returns nextState.
        Parameters:
        currentState - Current state against which we have an incoming event
        event - Incoming event for which we'd like to figure out the next state
        Returns:
        State into which we should transition as result of given event

        Description copied from interface: BundleEventListener
        Handles a message sent from Gecko.
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface BundleEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - The name of the event being sent.
        message - The message data.
        callback - The callback interface for this message. A callback is provided only if the originating call included a callback argument; otherwise, callback will be null.

      • getMCC

        public static int getMCC()
        These are called from JavaScript ctypes. Avoid letting ProGuard delete them. Note that these methods must only be called after GeckoAppShell has been initialized: they depend on access to the context. Not part of the state machine flow.
